snippet: A program to offer long-acting birth control, like free IUDs and implants, has helped reduce teenage pregnancies by 40 percent and abortions by 42 percent.
abstract: Colorado has experienced surprising success with six-year experimental effort to curb teenage births, in which teens and poor women were offered free intrauterine devices and implants that prevent pregnancy for years; state's teenage birthrate fell 40 percent from 2009 to 2013, while rate of teen abortions dropped 42 percent.
lead_paragraph: A program to offer long-acting birth control, like free IUDs and implants, has helped reduce teenage pregnancies by 40 percent and abortions by 42 percent.

headline.main: Colorado’s Effort Against Teenage Pregnancies Is a Startling Success
headline.print_headline: Colorado Finds Startling Success in Effort to Curb Teenage Births

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
